summary: Fighter!Beau facing off against Childhood-Sweetheart-Turned-Rival!Jester with Fjord and Nott as their respective antagonistic...
body: Fighter!Beau facing off against Childhood-Sweetheart-Turned-Rival!Jester with Fjord and Nott as their respective antagonistic coaches. Featuring Caduceus as an unofficial medic and Caleb, who knows and is friends with all of these people, and is just watching from the sidelines with his head in his hands because the petty back-and-forth insults are getting more and more ridiculous and god just get a room, anybody.

tags: ^^^^ what happens when everyone forgets to buy snacks for the session
summary: “You’re gonna get your asses kicked and you didn’t even eat.”  Caduceus’s resigned sigh when he turns around and sees Beau and...
body:
“You’re gonna get your asses kicked and you didn’t even eat.”

Caduceus’s resigned sigh when he turns around and sees Beau and Jester in the fighting pit with everyone else preparing to throw down somehow encapsulates every D&D session ever.

reblog.comment:

summary: Weird as it is, I kind of want Matt to be basically the narrator for the Legend of Vox Machina. I understand narrators can be a...
body: Weird as it is, I kind of want Matt to be basically the narrator for the Legend of Vox Machina. I understand narrators can be a bit weird in general but Matt is great at describing things. The Sun tree scene when they first enter Whitestone is what I thought of, when they see the bodies hanging. Rewatching it though it wouldn’t really work since it is just what they see, and a good slow scroll might be just as good. This post is a mess so feel free to ignore it

reblog.comment: Weird as it is, I kind of want Matt to be basically the narrator for the Legend of Vox Machina. I understand narrators can be a bit weird in general but Matt is great at describing things. The Sun tree scene when they first enter Whitestone is what I thought of, when they see the bodies hanging. Rewatching it though it wouldn’t really work since it is just what they see, and a good slow scroll might be just as good. This post is a mess so feel free to ignore it

tags: look. As far as I know Pelor's chill.
and i know sarenrae would be like 'Pike no wtf are you doing'
but this is such an entertaining idea to me that i dont much care.
summary: One of my favourite things about Critical Role is that Pike, tiny adorable gnomish cleric, has canonically threatened TWO gods...
body:
One of my favourite things about Critical Role is that Pike, tiny adorable gnomish cleric, has canonically threatened TWO gods for the twins’ sake. I can just imagine her turning up in the afterlife, displeased with how things have gone down:

(turns to the Raven Queen, gauntlets on and fists raised) “SQUARE UP, ASSHOLE!” (points over at Pelor) “YOU’RE NEXT, DAWNFUCKER!”

(Sarenrae’s looking on, trying not to grin. “I should stop her… Eh, let’s give it five minutes. They’ll live.”)

blog.name: alligatoremma
blog.title: Name's Emma
blog.description: This is where I post about stuff I like. I have an art blog over at alligatoremmaart

body:
Get ready for some meta

I love how half of the Mighty Nein are living it up during the best time of their lives so far, while the other half are miserably trying to scrape themselves back together after tragedy.

Like, Fjord is somebody special for the first time, with so much more agency than before over what his life looks like.

Beau is surrounded by people who just take her as she is, which has never happened to her before. She gets to figure out who she is with people who actually care.

Jester, as much as she loves her home and her mother, gets to see the big, scary, beautiful world surrounded by people she loves and who love her right back.

Meanwhile, Yasha lost her wife and everything that ever made sense in her life, and now she’s chasing something without even knowing what she’s looking for.

Nott was content to live out her peaceful, humble days with her husband and baby, and now she’s a goblin far from home.

And Caleb had books, magic, family, friends, a lover, and a Purpose with a capital P. Now, aside from some new friends, all he has is a goal that could destroy him and the rest of the world with it.

I feel like there’s not enough data on Molly and Cad yet, but we’ll see

trail.content:
Get ready for some meta

I love how half of the Mighty Nein are living it up during the best time of their lives so far, while the other half are miserably trying to scrape themselves back together after tragedy.

Like, Fjord is somebody special for the first time, with so much more agency than before over what his life looks like.

Beau is surrounded by people who just take her as she is, which has never happened to her before. She gets to figure out who she is with people who actually care.

Jester, as much as she loves her home and her mother, gets to see the big, scary, beautiful world surrounded by people she loves and who love her right back.

Meanwhile, Yasha lost her wife and everything that ever made sense in her life, and now she’s chasing something without even knowing what she’s looking for.

Nott was content to live out her peaceful, humble days with her husband and baby, and now she’s a goblin far from home.

And Caleb had books, magic, family, friends, a lover, and a Purpose with a capital P. Now, aside from some new friends, all he has is a goal that could destroy him and the rest of the world with it.

I feel like there’s not enough data on Molly and Cad yet, but we’ll see
